meanings.definition: To carry out a task clumsily or incompetently.
meanings.sent1: He tends to botch things up when he rushes through them.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to botch simple tasks by not paying attention.
meanings.sent3: I tried to cook dinner, but I ended up with a botch of burnt food.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to fix the leaky faucet only resulted in a botch of water everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The new employee's attempt to assemble the chair was a complete botch.

meanings.definition: A clumsy or incompetent piece of work.
meanings.sent1: The painting hanging crookedly on the wall was a botch.
meanings.sent2: The botch of a cake she made was barely edible.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a magic trick turned into a hilarious botch.
meanings.sent4: The play was a botch of forgotten lines and missed cues.
meanings.sent5: The botch of a sculpture stood out among the masterpieces in the gallery.

meanings.sent1: The typo in the report was a noticeable botch.
meanings.sent2: She realized her botch in the calculations after submitting the project.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a joke ended in a botch that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The decision to trust him was a botch that cost them dearly.
meanings.sent5: The botch in the recipe resulted in a completely different dish than intended.
